winePairing.pairingText: Southern works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 10 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling
productMatches.description: The Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling is a dry, crisp, refreshing style of Riesling with beautiful fruit flavors, crisp acidity and an elegant finish. It offers inviting floral and mandarin aromas with a clean finish. This is an incredibly versatile food wine and my favorite with oysters.

recipes.instructions: Cook (reheat) the sausage according to the package directions.  (I like to cut mine into 2"to 3" chunks and split them lengthwise to get a  little more char on the pieces.)Bring 6 cups of water to a boil over medium heat.  Stir in the salt.Carefully whisk the grits into the water.  Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally.  You may have to add a little additional water if they become too thick.Once the grits are tender, stir in the butter, cream cheese, and cheddar cheese.  Stir until the cheeses are melted.  Stir in the pimientos.Serve with the grilled sausage.
